intro: Calyptranthe, commonly known as the Christmas moss, is a genus of mosses belonging to the family Calyptraceae. These plants are characterized by their small, delicate structure and are often found in moist, shaded environments. Calyptranthe species typically have a compact growth form with dense, cushion-like clusters. They possess a unique reproductive structure called a calyptra, which covers the developing sporangium. These mosses play an important role in ecological systems by contributing to soil stabilization and moisture retention.
